meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Belarus and Russia.
meanings.sent1: In Belarus, you can buy many things with just one rubel.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for rubels before traveling to Russia.
meanings.sent3: The rubel in my pocket felt like a magical coin.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes lit up when she saw the shiny rubel in my hand.
meanings.sent5: The rubel jingled in the cashier's hand as he counted them out.

meanings.sent1: I used a soft cloth to rubel the silver until it shone.
meanings.sent2: She carefully rubeled the shoes to make them look like new.
meanings.sent3: He decided to rubel the table vigorously, hoping it would bring good luck.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's shoes sparkled as if they had been rubeled by fairies.
meanings.sent5: The old lamp was rubeled until it gleamed brightly in the room.

meanings.definition: A type of fabric with a napped surface.
meanings.sent1: The rubel fabric felt soft against her skin.
meanings.sent2: She sewed a beautiful dress using rubel material.
meanings.sent3: The cat loved to nap on the rubel blanket due to its cozy texture.
meanings.sent4: The rubel upholstery added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent5: The rubel fabric was perfect for keeping warm on chilly evenings.
